description.p: Wolf-folk are a rare sight in the world, and due to their physical resemblance to werewolves, they are often mistaken for the latter. This has made it challenging for them to form a distinct identity as a separate race. Wolf-folk are a resilient people, and they continue to preserve and celebrate their culture despite their rarity in the world.

At the age of 5, young Wolf-folk attain the size and development equivalent to a 10-year-old human, and reach adulthood at the age of 10. Their lifespan can last up to around 200 years, providing them with a longer life compared to many other races.

Wolf-folk tend to remain neutral in most arguments, as they tend to uphold their natural instincts and avoid taking sides. They prioritize maintaining a sense of balance and harmony, rather than engaging in disputes that can disrupt the peace.

Wolf-folk are typically taller and heavier than humans, standing at a height of well over 6 feet and weighing an average of almost 250 pounds. Despite their larger size, they are still classified as a medium-sized race.
Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
You can speak, read, and write Common, and another language.
